prior_works.title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding
prior_works.authors: Jacob Devlin, Ming-Wei Chang, Kenton Lee, Kristina Toutanova
prior_works.relationship_sentence: PLMTrajRec’s core idea—leveraging a large pre-trained language model and fine-tuning on small domain data—directly follows BERT’s masked modeling and transfer-learning paradigm, enabling scalable recovery with limited dense trajectories.

prior_works.title: BERT4Rec: Sequential Recommendation with Bidirectional Encoder Representation from Transformer
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Treating trajectory recovery as sequence completion parallels BERT4Rec’s bidirectional masked-item prediction, informing PLMTrajRec’s formulation of missing GPS points as masked tokens to be reconstructed from context.

prior_works.title: Decision Transformer: Reinforcement Learning via Sequence Modeling
prior_works.relationship_sentence: By casting trajectories as sequences for autoregressive/Transformer modeling, Decision Transformer provided a clear precedent that sequential decision/mobility data can be effectively modeled by language-model architectures, supporting PLMTrajRec’s PLM backbone choice.

prior_works.title: Hidden Markov Map Matching Through Noise and Sparseness
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The classic HMM map-matching framework established how road topology and transition likelihoods constrain feasible paths under sparsity, a principle PLMTrajRec leverages when conditioning PLM-based recovery on road constraints.

prior_works.title: ST-Matching: Map Matching for Low-Sampling-Rate GPS Trajectories
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ST-Matching demonstrates robust recovery of paths between widely spaced observations using spatial-temporal cues, directly informing PLMTrajRec’s goal of generalization across varying sampling intervals.

prior_works.title: Spatio-Temporal Graph Convolutional Networks: A Deep Learning Framework for Traffic Forecasting
prior_works.authors: Bing Yu, Haoteng Yin, Zhanxing Zhu
prior_works.relationship_sentence: STGCN showed how to extract and propagate traffic states over road graphs; PLMTrajRec builds on this idea to incorporate road conditions as contextual signals when inferring missing trajectory points.

prior_works.title: CSDI: Conditional Score-based Diffusion Models for Imputation of Missing Values in Multivariate Time Series
prior_works.authors: Yusuke Tashiro, Jiaming Song, Stefano Ermon
prior_works.relationship_sentence: CSDI introduced a powerful conditional imputation paradigm that handles diverse missing patterns; PLMTrajRec adopts a similar conditional-reconstruction mindset to handle heterogeneous sampling gaps in trajectories.

synthesis_narrative:
PLMTrajRec’s key contribution—scalable, generalizable recovery of missing GPS points via pre-trained language models—sits at the intersection of sequence reconstruction, road-constrained path inference, and traffic context modeling. At its foundation, BERT established masked-language pretraining and transfer learning, demonstrating that large PLMs fine-tuned on small domain datasets can achieve strong performance; BERT4Rec translated this to sequential reconstruction by masking items and predicting them bidirectionally, directly mirroring trajectory point completion. Decision Transformer further legitimized treating trajectories as sequences suitable for Transformer-based generative modeling, reinforcing the architectural choice of a PLM backbone for mobility data.

On the domain side, Newson and Krumm’s HMM map matching and the ST-Matching algorithm provide principled mechanisms to respect road-network constraints and handle sparse observations, which PLMTrajRec leverages to ensure recovered points lie on feasible paths and remain robust across varying sampling intervals. To enrich inference with real-world context, STGCN demonstrated how traffic states can be extracted and propagated over road graphs, guiding PLMTrajRec’s incorporation of road condition signals for improved fidelity at missing segments. Finally, CSDI’s conditional imputation under arbitrary missingness informs PLMTrajRec’s strategy to handle heterogeneous gaps and diverse sparsity patterns. Together, these works supply the methodological scaffolding—masked sequence reconstruction, trajectory-as-sequence modeling, road-constrained inference, and traffic-aware context—that PLMTrajRec unifies within a scalable PLM-driven framework.
